item.title: Programming Erlang
item.description: :ID: 1daea4ea-40bc-406d-8d03-906c7f9ec343 :EXPORT_HUGO_CATEGORIES: “FP” :EXPORT_HUGO_TAGS: “Erlang” Notes from (Armstrong 2013). Part I: Why Erlang? A Whirlwind Tour of Erlang Syntax of Variables and Atoms Note that Erlang variables start with uppercase characters. So, X, This, and A_long_name are all variables. Names beginning with lowercase lettersâ€”for example, monday or friday are not variables but are symbolic constants called atoms. (Armstrong 2013) Compiling and Running “Hello World” in the Shell -module(hello). -export([start/0]). start() -> io:format("Hello world~n").
